alert.note: Alert for Rogers (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 09 at 8:58PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Rogers County through 930 PM CDT... At 857 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm over Catoosa. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations in or near the path include... Catoosa... Verdigris... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 233 and 242. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
